intro: Menepetalum schlechteri subsp. schlechteri, commonly known as the Schlechter's moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces fragrant, tubular flowers that are adapted for pollination by nocturnal insects such as moths. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical forests. The subspecies is distinguished by its specific leaf and flower morphology compared to other members of the Menepetalum genus.
